column4: My usb drive is not showing anymore, I have important files there..Is anyone able to help me?
Try Disk Mounter, if on Gnome
I try to mount it, but I cant. I do get this message when I plug it in "[sda] Assuming drive cache: write through"
Its possible
Please tell me that I can recover the data...Its really important
Either finda win PC and safe remove or check for a forcr mount command in google

I did it, when to windows, unistall and install de usb drive, detected, and it shows now, but if I try to access it, it said that it doesnt have a format, and that I should format it....Is there anything I can do beside formating the usb drive

I did it, I went to windows, uninstall and install de usb drive. Windows detected it, and it shows now in MyPC, but if I try to access it, it said that it doesnt have a format, and that I should format it....Is there anything I can do beside formating the usb drive
Yes, there was a wonderful Linux respore program, which name I forgot
Could it be Photorec?
Was running in 80*30 window
No
While I was trying different linux distros, Fedora did similar stuff to mine 1TB internal drive
The program fixed all, it is available with apt-get, but I forgot the name :(
The problem is that I was backing up a PC, but I was moving, not copying the files, so now I will lose them
Was starting with a ? about type of machine, ~ 10 choices
That's why you copy first, then delete the orig
I learn that the hard way
Me too, but I share my mistakes :)
check http://linux.software.informer.com/download-linux-fix-disk-utility/
Finally I format it hoping for the best. Now I am trying to recover as much data as possible with photorec :(
